title: Joe Biden Wins Big In South Carolina. Now What?
description:
The Associated Press has called the South Carolina primary race for former Vice President Joe Biden. It gives his campaign a much needed boost ahead of the slew of Super Tuesday contests in three days.

Bernie Sanders has an infrastructure advantage in the coming contests, but will Biden's momentum and Mike Bloomberg's cash imperil his shot at the Democratic nomination?

This episode: White House correspondent Tamara Keith, campaign correspondents Scott Detrow and Asma Khalid.

itunes:title: Joe Biden Wins Big In South Carolina. Now What?
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: In his third presidential campaign in as many decades, Joe Biden has won his first state primary. Does he have the momentum to overcome Bernie Sanders on Tuesday?
itunes:subtitle: In his third presidential campaign in as many decades, Joe Biden has won his first state primary. Does he have the momentum to overcome Bernie Sanders on Tuesday?
